playbookrules.language: Changes to the counterparty is acceptable if it is the name listed on the netting opinion.
Any changes to the name of the Goldman Sachs contracting entity must be rejected.

The following is acceptable:

This Term Sheet represents the current understanding of the parties and does not constitute a legally binding agreement nor create any legally binding obligation.

segments.text: This Term Sheet represents the current understanding of the parties with respect to certain of the major issues relating to the Credit Support Annex and does not constitute a legally binding agreement. This summary does not constitute a legally binding obligation. Any other legally binding obligation will only be made pursuant to definitive agreements to be negotiated and executed by the parties.

playbookrules.language: It is fine to include FX Spots.

segments.text: Terms of the Credit Support Annex:

playbookrules.language: EUR or Great British Pound GBP are acceptable. However, CP Risk and Treasury must opine for any deviations from USD. Credit must only approve deviations from EUR, GBP, USD.

playbookrules.confirmed_language: Confirm that no changes has been made to Base Currency and Eligible Currency.
playbookrules.language: Never accept an Eligible Currency different than the Base Currency (USD). Escalate to the Federation teams and CVA for any deviations, or if the request is for several Eligible Currencies.

segments.text: Eligible Currency:                                                                Same as Base Currency.

playbookrules.language: Text of "on or after March 1, 2017" can be changed if confirmed that there are no executed in-scope trades prior to the date of execution of the CSA. Trade information can be confirmed with either Credit or Sales.

playbookrules.confirmed_language: Confirm that the Eligible Collateral is cash only.
playbookrules.language: CP Risk, MCVO and CRMA must always approve before any non-cash collateral is accepted. Note that the denomination of any non-cash collateral approved by Treasury, CP Risk, MCVO and CRMA should always match the Eligible Currency and the Base Currency. CRMA must also approve the Rating Ranges and Valuation Percentages as applicable to Counterparty. Treasury would need to approve any Ratings Ranges and Valuation Percentages that apply against Goldman Sachs.
Any deviation in the Valuation Percentage must be escalated to CRMA for approval.
Any deviation on Rounding must be approved by MCVO and Treasury. Credit should be posted.

MTA of 250,000 for Counterparty requires CRMA approval required before it can be accepted. If CRMA approve a 250,000 MTA for Counterparty, the MTA for GSI should also be set at 250,000, subject to Treasury approval.

Changes to the counterparty is acceptable. However, the change must match up to the name of the counterparty indicated near the top of the term sheet. Changes to the counterparty is acceptable if it is the name listed on the netting opinion.

If Counterparty CMU is located in London, the Counterparty should accept 12 noon London time.

If Counterparty CMU is located in the US:
- 10 am New York time can be accepted
- any time from (and including) 11am New York time to (and including) 1 p.m. New York time can be accepted if Eligible Collateral is USD cash only
- any other request of a time later than 10am New York time (not meeting the above requirement) to be escalated to MCVO.

All other requested times to be escalated to MCVO.

Any request to specify a Notification Time (and a corresponding Resolution Time) that is earlier than 12 noon, London time must be escalated to CPRT, Tech, CRMA and MCVO.
Any new Special Conditions must be escalated to Legal.
Any changes from Standard must be rejected.

segments.text: Standard or Modified Interest Transfer:                              Standard

playbookrules.language: Changes to applicability of Negative Interest must be escalated to CP Risk.
Any new provisions must be escalated to Legal and CRMA.

segments.text: This Term Sheet may be executed in counterparts, which together will constitute one document. Electronic signatures shall have the same legal effect as original signatures.
